alert.note: Alert for Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Natrona County through 345 PM MDT... At 314 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Midwest, or 27 miles southeast of Kaycee, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, along with heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Teapot Rock. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 205 and 229. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.
